fields.description:
See attached screenshot.

Before 1.9.6.0, the default was set to highlight 'OK'. 

When tapping the Enter key on the keyboard, the 'Cancel' is selected and nothing happens. As a versioning program, no change is permanent so I don't know why 'Cancel' should be the default action. As programmers, we do not use the mouse to click OK in the pop up, we want to press enter after selecting an action that we WANT to do.
fields.summary: Remove modified or untracked files dialogue window defaults to 'Cancel' instead of 'OK'.

fields.description:
Github has publicly stated that repository polling is bad practice, yet SourceTree still ships with polling enabled by default. 

Source: https://gist.github.com/michellini/a05f3068f29107caab88

Please consider changing this to Disabled by default, and even potentially warning people of the pitfalls of polling when they attempt to enable the feature.
fields.summary: Disable Repository Polling by Default

fields.description:
Github has publicly stated that repository polling is bad practice, yet SourceTree still ships with polling enabled by default. 

Source: https://gist.github.com/michellini/a05f3068f29107caab88

Please consider changing this to Disabled by default, and even potentially warning people of the pitfalls of polling when they attempt to enable the feature.
fields.summary: Disable Repository Polling by Default

fields.description:
For the last few versions, the Ctrl+Shift+C shortcut to jump to the commit message window isn't working (Shift+Alt+C works but takes the view from a split view to a flat one).

My normal flow would be something like - split view, staged files on top, modified files on bottom. 

* I select the first modified file
* If I want to add it, I use Ctrl+Shift++(plus), otherwise, I use the down arrow to select the next in line
* If I use Ctrl+Shift++(plus), selection automatically jumps to the next one
* Continue as needed
* When ready, hit Ctrl+Shift+C. Controls now jumps to the commit window where I can write my message and commit

What's happening now:

* I select the first modified file
* If I want to add it, I use Ctrl+Shift++(plus)
* Control disappears - the next changed file is no longer selected, I have to manually click it again with the mouse
* Continue as needed
* When ready, hit Ctrl+Shift+C, but nothing happens. Again, I have to use the mouse to manually set control into the commit window

It's not a big bug, but it does slow me down every time I commit something. 

This behaviour isn't present on the Mac version, where the shortcut keys work as intended.

This bug has been present in at least the last 3 versions
fields.summary: Ctrl+Shift+C no longer working to commit files

fields.description: Specifically Kaspersky, see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-2093?focusedCommentId=688601&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-688601
fields.summary: Investigate the effects of Anti-Virus on SourceTree performance

fields.description:
There have been a number of reports of poor performance on Windows 7 or Windows 10 for the latest SourceTree releases.

We have conflicting reports of performance of the latest versions improving along with upgrading to Windows 10 improving performance, along with reports of the opposite.
fields.summary: Investigate Performance of 1.9.x SourceTree on Windows version

fields.description: see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-2093?focusedCommentId=674896&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-674896
fields.summary: Investigate the effect of Windows Presentation Foundaction FontCache

fields.description:
Generate a set of benchmarks for common actions against large, complex open source projects
e.g. Clone, Commit, Pull, Push, Status etc.

These can then be used to measure relative performance on user's workstations.
fields.summary: Benchmark SourceTree performance with respect to command line Git/Hg

fields.description: see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-2093?focusedCommentId=796237&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-796237
fields.summary: Investigate effect of full Temp folder on SourceTree Performance

SourcetreeMac supports templates for commit messages since version 2.3
When will this feature be available for SourcetreeWin too?

Would really appreciate it! Thanks in advance.

fields.description:
SourcetreeMac supports templates for commit messages since version 2.3
When will this feature be available for SourcetreeWin too?

Would really appreciate it! Thanks in advance.

fields.description:
When a branch is created with a comma in it "," (which is a valid character), the branch name does not display properly in the Log / History. Everything after the first comma is cut off.
The branch name in the sidebar is correct.

The details of the commit are a little off. It displays in the labels, but it is adding an extra space after the comma.
fields.summary: Customer report: Branches with commas in name do not display properly in Log/History

fields.description: SourceTree on Windows should prompt to elevate when running as a non-admin user and attempting to update embedded Git. Updating git requires writing to program files dir which requires admin rights and this operation will fail if running as a non-admin user
fields.summary: Customer request: SourceTree should elevate (UAC) when updating embedded Git

fields.description: At various times during the day while SourceTree is open some of the text will disappear on the buttons at the top of the app. Generally when this happens it is all of the buttons from fetch to the right. I have attached a screenshot of the issue. Restarting the application will usually fix it, but after a period of time I will go back to the app and the button titles will be gone again.
fields.summary: Text on main nav bar buttons disappears randomly while SourceTree is open.

fields.description: Other fetch options in the same dialogue will stay checked always, except for fetch all tags.  You have to re click the check box every time.
fields.summary: Fetch all tags check box does not stay checked after pulls.

fields.description:
I use to be able to gitsvn clone an SVN repo using the clone dialog in sourcetree. When I do it now I get the "This is not a valid source path / url". When I click on details I get "System.COmponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the file specified. fatal: repository not found"

However, cloning by ST terminal works fine:

git svn clone http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/
fields.summary: I can't clone an SVN repisitory

fields.description:
The UI was updating painfully slow.  For example after a commit, the symbol showing that something needs to be pushed would not show up for a minute.
At one point the UI totally froze and wouldn't update, so I closed the program and attempted to restart, but it won't open.  Rebooted the system and it still will not open.  Now I am going to try uninstalling and reinstalling - that's not working either, see attached.
Rebooted and was able to uninstall, now sourcetree will run but I can't see any of the info in the main pane, see attached 2.

After closing and trying to reopen, sourcetree is back to the initial state of refusing to run.

I got the repos to open, this ticket can be closed, wasted a few hours with this today!
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed and won't run

fields.description:
SourceTree 1.9.6.1 is constantly asking for Authentication for the remote server.

There is no indication why SourceTree need the authentication credentials.
The Authenticate dialog also takes focus from other windows which is very annoying when typing something and the SourceTree will display the dialog.

Expected behavior: SourceTree should not display the Authentication dialog.
fields.summary: SourceTree is constantly prompting for authentication

fields.description:
When merging a branch using non-fast-forward, I would like to be able to edit the commit message. When editing the commit message, the default commit message should be displayed to me, so that I can edit that as I see fit.

Perhaps when the 'confirm merge' dialog is shown, see screenshot, a text field can be included that contains the default commit message, which we can edit, and this message is used as the commit message.
fields.summary: Edit commit message when merging branches
Create patch, while create patch It requires to select at least one file even I selected it. And It refuses creating a patch.

fields.description:
After staging the files, when 'Commit' is clicked, the progress bar shows as thought the files are getting committed.
Then, this popup shows up, saying 'SourceTree has stopped working'.

The issue is noticed in 'Commit' (with & without the 'Push' ticked).

On closing and re-opening the source, we can see that the files are committed & ready for push (or already pushed, if the checkbox is ticked).
fields.summary: issue while 'Commit' - SourceTree freezes/Not Responding

fields.description:
Go to file status. Have a folder with 2+ files visible. 

Current behaviour:
if you select every files in this folder, the folder is ticked.
if you select files in this folder, but not all of them the folder is not ticked. This can lead to commit files without knowing it.

Wished behaviour:
if you select every files in this folder, the folder is ticked.
if you select files in this folder, but not all of them the folder is ticked with a light grey tick (as in previous tree versions).
fields.summary: File status > Tree view: folders partially selected should be ticked with a grey tick

fields.description:
With a repository open and active in SourceTree the Explorer toolbar button (situated between the Terminal and Settings toolbar buttons) is always disabled.\

However the "Show in Explorer" menu item on the top-level Actions menu is functional.

Also, the "Open in Explorer" button that appears below the "Nothing to commit" message in the "File Status" view is also functional.
fields.summary: Explorer toolbar button disabled

fields.description:
[http://i.imgur.com/GZjpdjM.png]

 

as the screeshot above,

 

sometimes I don't need to update the currently new version at once,

maybe the feature in this version I think no need to immediately update,

 

hence I want  just jump this update version and wait for next newer update version,

 

Thus,

 

I hope in update option, there is  "jump this version" option to let me choose, thanks

fields.description:
In previous sourcetree versions, when you modify a submodule, you could see a little gizmo (3 points) next to the submodule, warning you that that submodule has been changed.
It was a very useful feature, and is now gone.
fields.summary: SubModule warning icon has been removed in the latest version.

fields.description: When trying to switch branches an error occurs saying the git is locked. You have to exit source tree and start it again to switch the branch.
fields.summary: When switching branches source tree often fails with an error

fields.description:
Customer report:

{quote}
I updated my SourceTree from 1.8.x to 1.9.5 after a system restart told me there was an update on 7/27/2016 on my Window 10 box.

Since then I am unable to successfully drag and drop book marks without them disappearing.

I add a new book mark by clicking the Clone/New button and choose the Add Working Copy tab, as this is a local repo that connects to a bitbucket remote.

I then browse to the folder and click add.

The bookmark appears a the bottom of the list.

I select it and it highlights in blue.

I click it and start dragging, the drop indicator appears. I drop it and it disappears and I am left in a perpetual state of drag-selecting so that multiple bookmarks are being selected as I move the mouse.

Clicking again exits this perpetual drag-selection state.
{quote}

Still happening on 1.9.6.1:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/atblwsrrbujxv01/sourcetree.avi?dl=0
fields.summary: Customer report: Drag and Drop of Bookmarks causes them to disappear.

fields.description: Allow the user to specify that certain branches be excluded from the Log/History view.  This would be similar to the functionality in the "git log --exclude=<BranchOne> --exclude=<BranchTwo> --branches" command.  The log view would show all commits that are reachable from non-excluded branch refs.
fields.summary: Option to exclude specific branches from log/history view

fields.description: Presently there are two drop-down menus on the Log/History view that each select between two options.  Thus it takes two clicks to toggle either of these options.  A checkbox or some other single-click control would make it easier to quickly toggle between options.
fields.summary: Do not use drop-downs to select between current/all branch view and ancestor/date order
Option for user to ignore Submodules(as available for Clone) during branch checkout/switch

fields.description: If I select I file from staged it will display the diff for it but when I try to view diff for a unstaged file the staged one remains selected and I have to manually deselect it to get the correct diff.
fields.summary: Unstaged file diff shows staged file diff if staged file is selected.

fields.description:
Crash when committing on a remote repo
N.B. when I start up the app it shows me a warning message that I need to update my mercurial version for security reasons.
fields.summary: SRCTREEWIN-1961

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Japanese characters is garbled in diff view and cannot discard hunk/line with error.

h3. Environment

- Windows  7 (SP1), SourceTree 1.9.6.1
- Windows 10, SourceTree 1.9.6.1 with Embedded Git 2.8.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set ‘Default text encoding’ to ‘shift_jis’ in ST (Tools > Options)
# Create a file encoded with shift_is and commit it in local repo.
# Edit the file to change a few lines in Japanese.
 !git internal diff 01.png|thumbnail! 
# ST detects the changes and choose ‘Stage hunk’ (or ‘Stage line’)
# the characters are garbled in diff view 
#  !git internal diff 02.png|thumbnail! 
# Then choose ’Discard hunk’ (or ‘Discard line’, Error occurs saying that ‘git apply’ failed with code 1
 !git apply error.png|thumbnail! 

The error is similar with SRCTREEWIN-3810, but setting default encoding doesn’t resolve this problem.

h3. Expected Results

Japanese characters should be shown correctly when specified default encoding.

h3. Actual Results

Japanese characters is garbled and user cannot edit/commit files by hunk.

h3.Workaround

Not found.
fields.summary: Japanese characters is garbled in diff view and cannot discard hunk/line with error

fields.description:
After beginning a rebase, it is too easy to accidentally click "Abort Rebase" instead of "Continue Rebase" from the app menu.  Could you please add a modal dialog for users to confirm that they indeed want to abort their current rebase?

This could save many users - including myself - from accidentally aborting a rebase in progression because of a bad mouse click.  Thank you!
fields.summary: Add confirmation dialog to Abort Rebase menu option

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking 'Stage all'/'Unstage all' doesn't refresh the UI automatically

h3. Environment
SourceTree for Windows 1.9.6.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a repo in SourceTree
# Edit a file in that repo and save it
# In SourceTree, in this repo's window, open the 'File Status' tab
# Make sure 'Split view staging' is selected
# Click 'Stage all'

h3. Expected Results
The file you just edited should be moved from 'Unstaged files' panel to 'Staged' panel

h3. Actual Results
The file remains in 'Staged files' panel

h3.Workaround
* Refresh by clicking F5

or

* Go to the 'Log/History' tab of the repo and switch back to 'File Status' tab
fields.summary: Clicking 'Stage all'/'Unstage all' doesn't refresh the UI automatically

fields.description:
Interactive rebase operations frequently fail with this message:

error: There was a problem with the editor ''C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\stree_gri''

Full output log:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c "sequence.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\stree_gri'" -c "core.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\stree_gri'" rebase --continue
error: There was a problem with the editor ''C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\stree_gri''.
Please supply the message using either -m or -F option.

Could not commit staged changes.

Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase operations frequently fail

*To regenerate*: 
 1. select a staged file and click Unstage Selected.

*expected behaviour*:

stage selected option should be available

*actual behaviour*:

The option is grayed out

fields.description:
after updating SourceTree to 1.9.6.1 (not sure from which version, definitely older than 1.9.6) existing submodules are no longer shown in the repository view. In the left column of the repository view the categories file status, branches, tags and remotes are visible, but submodules is missing, despite submodules existing in the filesystem and config.

this is a rather bad situation as we are heavily relying on submodules.

please look into this or advice how I can temporarily downgrade to an older version.

PS: when updating SourceTree the updater showed two updates, 1.9.6.1 and 1.9.6, with the former pre-selected. I did not change the selection and proceeded, could this be part of the problem?

fields.description:
Select any file in staged view. Click in the whitespace in the staged view. I expect all selected files to be deselected, instead nothing happens.

This has been an issue for over a year at least that I've been using SourceTree and makes a lot of interactions while staging feel very clunky and non-standard.
fields.summary: Clicking in the blank areas in staged/unstaged file view should deselect all files

fields.description:
When users selects Remove option in the left toolbar he's been asked for a confirmation, like:

(!) Confirm remove?
 * Remove Bookmarks
 * Delete Repositories on Disk
 * Cancel

Clicking Delete Repositories on Disk is hazardous and should either be removed completely or have to ask for additional confirmation like:

(x) All files from the filesystem will be removed, git history deleted. This action can not be undone. Do you want to proceed?

 

Real-life use case:
 # New to a SourceTree user adds a project that is not under VCS yet. 
 # After playing around with SourceTree user decides to remove project from the SourceTree.
 # He selects the Remove option..
 # He asked about the Bookmarks (which looks like unrelated option) and proceed with a Delete which wipes out the sources of the project.

 

Suggested solutions:
 * Always delete to Trash + show additional notification for user to discover the project location
 * Do not delete project
 * Delete only git history, but keep the sources (kinda reverse action to git init).

(/) This behaviour would be aligned to how project bookmark removal works in the popular IDEs.

 

*Other real cases*

Watch this topic & votes [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16144022/restore-deleted-files-from-sourcetree-or-git]

 

*Data Recovery*

For whom it may concern - this have helped to recover the missing data
 # copy the remaining .git/objects to a new folder
 # run git init in the new folder
 # run git fsck
 # cherry-pick commits that found

Recovery guide was found here [http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5767593/recovering-git-repository-from-objects-only]
fields.summary: Delete repository message is misleading and can cause user data loss

fields.description: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/9874707/sourcetree-how-to-show-sidebar-
fields.summary: User can accidentally get rid of the entire sidebar and it's very hard to get back

fields.description:
I just updated to version 1.9.6.1 and if I try to commit using the contextual menu (right click), the application crash. When I reopen the application, I can see that the commit succeeded. Also, I am able to commit using the commit button in the ribbon menu without any problem.

Step to reproduce:
1- alter the code
2- select "Uncommitted changes"
3- click on "Stage All" to staged the changes
4- right click in the "Staged files" section and click on "commit"
5- enter a message and click on the commit button

What's expected:
The changes are committed and the user is able to continue using SourceTree

What's happening:
The application crashes
fields.summary: Source Tree crash while committing in v1.9.6.1

fields.description: I setup SourceTree external Diff/Merge tool to use Tortoise. In my repository I happened to have a file with a space in its name. When I try to open an external merge tool, the file is not found because SourceTree does not supply the full name but only the part before the space.
fields.summary: External Diff/Merge tool cannot open a file with a space in its name
Create patch shows strange error dialog requesting a selected file
copying path of log files

fields.description:
1. Right click on a tracked file
2. Select `Stop Tracking`

Expected result: the file becomes untracked and a deletion action is added to the staging area

Actual result: nothing happens

Notes:

- my Atlassian Questions question - https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39785117/comments/39993779 - got a response from another user, "The issue seems to be that the cancel and Okay button functionality is switched up for that option.  Hitting cancel actually made it stop tracking the file(s) for me". I haven't checked this myself as I went back to 1.8.3.0.
fields.summary: "Stop Tracking" doesn't do anything

fields.description:
Hi Folks :)

Apologies if this is duplicated somewhere! It'd be pretty swell if GPG signature verification could be displayed somewhere within SourceTree on windows to show when commits/tags are signed/verified. Perhaps a badge on the commit row or even within the current commit info pane (that has the commit id, parents, dates and msg etc.). We are currently using gpg4win (https://jamesmckay.net/2016/02/signing-git-commits-with-gpg-on-windows/) successfully with SourceTree and can git log --show-signature ok within terminal but having this additional info displayed within SourceTree would be great :)

Keep up the awesome work!
Mike.
fields.summary: Show additional info when commit/tags are signed

fields.description:
Add the stash.
If collapsed stashes list then expand the stashes list then collapse it again.

Expected Result: Should open same list of stashes.
Actual Result: Doubles the stashes list.

Node: Potential issue - The list in UI that stores Stashes elements is not being cleared.
fields.summary: Stashes tab sduplicate stash list every time it gets expanded.

fields.description: Impossible to select file to stage/commit
fields.summary: Check box for staging doesn't exist anymore

fields.description:
When managing repos with long names, the displayed name in the tab can be unclear. Also when managing a large number of repos, it can become rather inconvenient scrolling back and forth to find the required tab.

It would be useful to have a quick select dropdown as an alternative means to select a repo, rathar like the 'Jump to:' action that allows you to select a branch in the active repo.
fields.summary: Improve tab selection

fields.description:
I'm using SourceTree 1.9.6.1 on Windows 7 Enterprise SP1.

I have a private key file that I generated with PuttyGen and saved to a file with no file extension.  I can load the file fine from Pageant and SSH functions in SourceTree work fine after doing so.

I have configured the SSH Key option in SourceTree with the path to my PK file.

!https://answers.atlassian.com/download/attachments/39994475/image2016-8-18%2016%3A19%3A11.png?version=1&modificationDate=1471551562253&api=v2!

However, the key is not loaded into Pageant when SourceTree launches Pageant during startup.  I am also prompted to load the key file if Pageant is not running and I use the Launch SSH Agent... function from the Tools menu.  If I say Yes and browse to the file, the SSH Key option is automatically configured with the correct path to the extensionless file, as I would expect.

If I add the .ppk extension to the file everything works as expected.  Pageant is launched during SourceTree startup and my key file is loaded by Pageant.  Also, launching Pageant from the command line with the path to the extensionless file works fine.

This is clearly not high priority issue, rather a minor annoyance, but I thought I would submit something on it anyway.

(Originally posted [here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39994475/start-pageant-using-private-key-file-with-no-extension], but didn't realize that was not for bug reports!)
fields.summary: Using extensionless key file does not load the key into Pageant

fields.description: When opening carets in the "REMOTES" section of the UI, sometimes it doesn't draw properly, and entire lists of items that it should display are not shown. Closing and re-opening the carets usually fixes it. For example in the image enclosed when you open up "product" it should show 8 items, sometimes it shows just a couple.
fields.summary: Redraw issues in "REMOTES"

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a folder 'FolderA' with 3500 new files
# Switch to "File Status" tab
# Set the view to be "Tree View"
# Expand 'FolderA' to view all the files -> SourceTree hang
# Restart SourceTree
# Switch to "Flat List" single/multi column - no problem
# Commit all 3500 files in the repo
# Switch to "Log/History" tab
It will select the first commit automatically. Trying to load 3500 files at the bottom will cause SourceTree hang too

*workaround*:

The issue is with performance in the treeview, to avoid this flat view's should be used in preference to the treeview. 
There are currently two possible work arounds.

*Workaround 1: Reset the User preference, in v1.6.9 to 1.6.11, to use a flat view*

# Shutdown SourceTree
# Find the <Version>/user.config file in a folder below %localappdata%/Atlassian/SourceTree where <version> is 1.6.9, 1.6.10 or 1.6.11
# Edit the user.config and set FileStatusViewMode to 0, i.e:
{code}
            <setting name="FileStatusViewMode" serializeAs="String">
                <value>0</value>
            </setting>
{code}
# Restart SourceTree

*Workaround 2: Revert to 1.6.8*
A workaround is by uninstalling the current version and install SourceTree version 1.6.8:

- https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/SourceTreeSetup_1.6.8.exe


*This is still an issue in version 2.3.1*
fields.summary: Too many files will cause SourceTree to hang

fields.description:
It is easy to get GitHub pull requests as branches. This allows us to fully manage PRs, entirely in SourceTree, without you having to extend the app / UX at all.

PRs are hosted at `refs/pull/*/heads`. The default git config only fetches from `refs/head/*`. All SourceTree would have to do is add one more fetch spec to the git config, and everything else works.

See https://gist.github.com/piscisaureus/3342247 for directions. I did this myself and it gave me exactly the experience I wanted.

Not sure what you'd have to add for BitBucket (how it stores PRs), but I suspect something similar?
fields.summary: Trivial way to support GH Pull Requests

fields.description:
When you have more repository tabs than will fix in the available width, there are arrows to scroll the tab bar.

These arrows seem to jump the bar some fixed number of pixels.  The amount it scrolls for each click is far too small.  It seems to be just 20 pixels or something.  It takes several clicks just to scroll the width of one tab.  In my case it takes 13 clicks to scroll one tab.

My suggestion would be to have each click scroll one whole tab to make navigating the tabs much easier.
fields.summary: Tab scrolling is too slow

fields.description:
When opening multiple repositories, it appears each successive repo tab is just slightly smaller than the previous tab.  I'm not sure of the reasoning but it's not very effective.

In my case, I have tabs that are far wider than they need to be and it ends up causing me to have to scroll between tabs.

My suggestion would be to have tabs have a standard min/max width and not to just start getting smaller for no apparent reason.

The size of a tab should be the minimum size needed to display the text of the tab or min/max if that size would exceed those bounds.
fields.summary: Repository tab width is too wide and inconsistent
Switching to the new branch causes 3-4 time error: Another git process seems to be running in this repository, e.g.

fields.description: Sometimes some of the texts below the buttons are missing (see screenshot) - restart of program normally solves it.
fields.summary: Text below buttons sometimes missing

fields.description:
It would be great if one could select multiple repositories and execute the same command (e.g. pull or fetch) on them. That would allow one to refresh the work space with a single command, regardless of how many repositories one has.
Right now the command only works on a single repository that is active (the active tab in right part of the window). Given that some actions are less useful or even meaningless in context of multiple repositories (may be branch?) those can safely be disabled or a warning could be presented saying so.
fields.summary: allow group commands on multiple selected repositories

fields.description:
Per: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-4880

See attached screenshot. The merge files are created in the root of the repo as .merge_file_XXXXXX but the paths given to the merge tool are in the subfolder with the conflicted file and named packages_(LOCAL/BASE/REMOTE)_5520.config
fields.summary: External merge tool passed incorrect file paths

fields.description: I used to have the ability to select a file and click the Explorer button to open the Windows directory folder where the local copy is saved.  Following the last update, I no longer have this option and the Explorer button is always greyed out.
fields.summary: Explorer button greyed out in application window

fields.description:
If you select tracked modified file in a list "Stage selected" button is active.
 However, if you make a new modification to selected file, "Stage selected" button becomes inactive.

To workaround, select another file and then select needed file back. "Stage selected" button will appear active again.
fields.summary: Can not stage selected file after modification

fields.description:
Sometimes, when the first file in the unstaged area is selected, you'll want to select all those files in one go. I always do that by Shift+clicking on the last file.

It seems reproducible when switching from the File Status tab to the Log/History tab, and then shift+clicking on the bottom (of at least 2) unstaged file.

Not sure if this is the only situation where it doesn't work as expected, but there at least, it's reproducible.

And no, my Shift key is working absolutely perfectly :)
fields.summary: Selecting all files in unstaged area sometimes doesn't work

fields.description:
Sometimes, when the first file in the unstaged area is selected, you'll want to select all those files in one go. I always do that by Shift+clicking on the last file.

It seems reproducible when switching from the File Status tab to the Log/History tab, and then shift+clicking on the bottom (of at least 2) unstaged file.

Not sure if this is the only situation where it doesn't work as expected, but there at least, it's reproducible.

And no, my Shift key is working absolutely perfectly :)
fields.summary: Selecting all files in unstaged area sometimes doesn't work

fields.description:
Discarding a whole file isn't working.

In my case, the files I'm trying to discard only have whitespace changes. With the option "ignore whitespace" ticked, it shows no code changes. But, it doesn't matter which whitespace option is ticked, discarding the file won't work.It just simply doesn't work. No errors or anything.

It appears to try to do something, as the screen refreshes for a split second, but effectively nothing happens.
fields.summary: Discard file not working

fields.description:
Discarding a whole file isn't working.

In my case, the files I'm trying to discard only have whitespace changes. With the option "ignore whitespace" ticked, it shows no code changes. But, it doesn't matter which whitespace option is ticked, discarding the file won't work.It just simply doesn't work. No errors or anything.

It appears to try to do something, as the screen refreshes for a split second, but effectively nothing happens.
fields.summary: Discard file not working

fields.description:
Suppose you stage a file deletion. The diff will show each line of that file as removed, which is fine. Then, supppose you want to keep some of those lin, so you selected part of the file and hit the "Unstage lines" button.

Then:
!Capture.PNG|thumbnail!

Happens for any kind of diff-able file.
fields.summary: Unstaging changes of a file deletion

fields.description:
Pushing to a Git remote may sometimes take forever. The "show full output" option reveals the push command is just sitting there, doing absolutely nothing, with no warnings nor errors. It's just going on and on and on.

Trying again does the exact same thing. It's like ST is waiting for something that will never happen.

All that remains for me to do to work around the problem, is to restart ST. Windows doesn't report ST to be hung, so it wasn't ever frozen or anything like that. Just waiting, and that wait is then aborted somehow.

After the restart, pushing works fine again. For a while at least.
fields.summary: Pushing may sometimes take forever before a restart

fields.description:
Sometimes (randomly), I have changes to commit, I have selected them, entered a commit message but the "Commit" button stays disabled.

I have to copy to the clipboard my commit message, close and re-open SourceTree to be able to make my commit. This had happened in the previous version as well.
fields.summary: Commit button disabled even when there are pending changes selected in Hg

fields.description: Opening and closing the "Stash" parent folder causes stash lst entries to get duplicated.
fields.summary: Stash listing duplicates entries if the parent folder is closed and re-opened.

fields.description: If you create a new branch, and then immediately click pull, the previous branch will be updated instead of the new branch.  You essentially have to wait a few seconds for the sidebar to update with the new branch information.  At the very least, we should make the pull button un clickable until the sidebar updates.
fields.summary: Clicking the pull button before the sidebar updates with a newly created branch will result in the previous branch being updated instead of the newly created branch.
The Process dialog is too large

fields.description:
Add a feature to remove files by directory that were initially tracked by default (for example a badly configured .gitignore)

using the command git rm --cached -r <dir>

On creating a new project, the first Add/Remove could give an option to exclude directories, creating/adding them to the .gitignore by default (run-once-only).

Common locations could even by offered (for example all/some IDE output directories)
fields.summary: Add option to stop (and remove existing) already tracked files in a directory

fields.description:
When I try to clone a git repository over an authenticating proxy, SourceTree issues an error (see 1_ErrorMessage.png). The proxy is set up (see 2_NetworkOptions.png).

When I open the Authenticate window, I am able to enter both user name and password (see 3_FirstCallOfAuthenticateWindow.png). However, when I open the Authenticate window for the second time, the password field is empty (see 4_SecondCallOfAuthenticateWindow.png).

The password seems to be stored - there is an entry for "rainer@[proxy server]" (sic!) in %LOCALAPPDATA%\Atlassian\SourceTree\passwd.

The corresponding line in the proxy's access.log is
TCP_DENIED/407 1436 CONNECT github.com:443 - NONE/- text/html

For some reason the proxy authentication is not used.

Probably relates to STSP-4825

Has worked in earlier versions (definitely!).

PS: I am not interested in workarounds, but in a solution, so please forward this to the developers!
fields.summary: Unable to clone over authenticating proxy

fields.description:
While it used to work previously, Whenever I try to access the log / history tab on my sourcetree for a given repository, I get the attached error.

 

I am not aware of any changes made to the configuration which could have caused that. (And the specified folder does exist, as expected)
fields.summary: Accessing log / history tab fails on a previously working repository

fields.description: When the application is restarted any open tabs that are restored are created with a very small default width which is too small to read the repository name. So one ends up having to close and reopen all the tabs anyway.
fields.summary: Tabs restore too small to see repository name

fields.description:
The commit dots are not aligned with commit messages.

It happens on Windows 10 with default theme.
fields.summary: Commit graph nodes not aligned with commit messages.

fields.description: Look at my screenshot for more detail
fields.summary: Option dialog cannot fit in my screen

fields.description: Could you give us an option to COMPLETELY disable the SSH agent when using the system git? We don't need it. If SourceTree naively connects where we tell it to, the underlying system knows how to handle everything.
fields.summary: Add option to disable SSH agent management
Remote branches listing is not refreshed correctly.

fields.description:
Per [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-4878:]

This message while login in GitHub through Surce Tree.

The remote service said: "'Content-Type' is an unexpected token. The expected token is '""' or "'". Line 2, position 18.'

Additional Info :
 OS : windows 8.1 x64
 We are using internet through proxy server.

 

 

I already set proxy to Tools->Options->Network.

Checked - Custom proxy setting
Input : proxy server and port

Checked - Proxy server requires username and password
Input : Username and password

One note : This configuration problem is found in 1.8 and after version. But, same thing is working in 1.6 and 1.7 versions
fields.summary: Login Error : Login failed for your GitHub account

fields.description:
*When I have conflicts and try to launch merge tool, nothing happens.*
I've tried (use) embedded git, but have tried also system git.
Have TortoiseGit (*TortoiseGitMerge*) installed and it's available in the cmd (PATH value is set).

The only way to get some result is setting system default, but that's not a solution, since the path i need to do merge has spaces and it seems that system default uses arguments in the old tortoisemerge format (from the product tortoisesvn).

Anyhow, not being able to run merge, *not getting any errors, nor reasonable error messages is considered as a bug*. Since merging is a critical feature, issue is typed as blocker.

Important: inside process explorer under sh.exe sometimes i got a message: error opening process 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

but most of the time i just see the command that's causing the freezing of the app:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Merge tool not opening - solution inside comments

fields.description:
Since the Windows 10 Anniversary Update, we now have Linux Bash built into Windows.

https://msdn.microsoft.com/commandline/wsl/about

SourceTree should provide an option to use Bash for Windows instead of MINGW for the Terminal feature.
fields.summary: Use Bash on Windows 10

fields.description: "Stage All" button does not stage files on Windows
fields.summary: "Stage All" button does not stage files on Windows

fields.description: Global git ignore file not respected if the physical file sits on a network drive.  Global git ignore file must be on physical drive connected to the PC in order for SourceTree to respect it.
fields.summary: Global git ignore file not respected if the physical file sits on a network drive.

fields.description:
I should preface this by saying I'm fairly new to git (long time perforce user) so maybe my mind doesn't think in the "git way"...

* What's up with silly branch tree/swim lanes thing.  That's not helpful.  Its hard to follow.  I asked around work and no one really gets it.  I know all the git clients seem to add that, but it doesn't help :(

* git clients don't seem to want to deal with the source tree.  I'm used to seeing a tree type view where I can see all the files in the repo.  What I'd really like is to be able to look at a certain folder and see all the changes that have happened in that folder (according to my branch).  Basically a visualization of git log but filtered for the currently selected folder (and maybe optionally subfolders). When I select a change/commit, I'd like to be able to see details about it: commit message, files involved, diffs of the change

* A time lapse view would be nice too:  This is like blame but lets me walk "back in time".  Its a view of the file (basically blame) but at the top I can see a timeline of all the changes that have happened to this file.  I can drag a slider (or something) to let me go to a different version of the file.  Ideally, the scroll position doesn't change.  This lets me watch how the file has changed - like I said, like blame, but easier to move between versions. Here's perforce's version of this: https://www.perforce.com/support/tutorial-video-library/video/using-time-lapse-view

* There are times when I come to a branch I had worked on a couple of days ago, and I just want to see what's changed on this branch.  I really just want to see the commits since I branched so I know what I've changed.  I *think* that branch swim lane thing shows me this, but I see a bunch of other stuff too - stuff that happened before I branched.  I don't need to see that here.


Anyway... those are just some of the gripes we've been having around the office.  I assume if these things annoy us, they probably annoy others as well.
fields.summary: General Feedback from a customer to lazy to split his requests into multiple jira tickets :)

fields.description:
Since I upgraded from Windows 7 to Windows 10 SourceTree keeps crashing at me tens times a day. I reported the problem like million times using the built in crash report tool but to no avail. It is many weeks and several SourceTree versions ago since this started happening.

Anyway, the problem is like this:

I have PHP application repository open in SourceTree. The application is also served by apache locally on my workstation. Everytime (or mostly everytime) I refresh the running application in a browser, SourceTree just crashes and displays the error report window.

Please, do something about it, SourceTree is almost unusable at this time for me.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes every time I refresh my web app that Source Tree monitors

Appears to be being ignored even though correct paths are changing. Reports include:

fields.summary: Auto-refresh isn't working if commit is done outside of ST

fields.description:
Switching branches - fails to update UI
Endless loading when opening/switching repo

Have to close and reopen to 'hopefully get things to reset each time

crashes

When I updated about 4 days ago there were about 5-6 minor updates that were skipped over.

Whatever you have done in this release, makes it unusable on windows - I have mac version also which is just fine. And if I switch to cmd line all git status/activity is just fine. It is the Sourcetree UI that is bluntly screwed in this release.

You did good several months back, but it is now worse than it ever was before.

You have a week, otherwise I need myself and my team using something different along with command line.

Good luck!
fields.summary: version 1.9.50 - unusable

fields.description:
When browsing through commit history, the diff view/pane is hidden. To see the actual code changes in the commit, one has always to click on a file in a commit.

Could you be so kind to automatically open the diff view for the first file in the commit? This is what TortoiseHg does and it's really convenient.

Side thought: in fact, it would be even better to keep the last selected file per commit (maybe for 20 last visited commits or so), but I understand it may not be worth the effort.

Anyway, thanks for the awesome product, guys.
fields.summary: Auto-open diff view when browsing commit Log/History

fields.description:
A lot of people use source tree every day. Eventually they understand that it's much faster to use it with keyboard shortcuts.

I mean Source Tree was a really nice way of using git. Because you are provided with a lot of information on glance withoud typing terminal commands and still do things fast because of shortcuts.

It was really nice to use Source Tree. Until I updated for some unknown reason and now I just can't confirm your new shiny design popups from a keyboard because it just closes popup without confirming an action when I press Enter. It's definitely an unwanted behaviour because I press Esc when I am unsure I did the right thing. I press Alt-F4 when I am sure I did wrong thing and I press Alt-F4 when I am sad about a UI program over an essential tool for my work and I just go typing commands in Terminal and then cry as a bitch about my unhappy fate. And I press Enter when I am sure I am doing the right thing. When I Ctrl+Shift+R I am sure I want to revert selected files and I press Enter to confirm my intention and Source Tree just decides that I should calm the fuck down and think if I really want to revert my files. And I should Ctrl-Shift-R again pick up the goddamn mouse and press tiny little button OK AM REALLY WANT TO REVERT MY FILES JUST GO AWAY FUCKING POPUP WINDOW.

Please make popup windows understand Enter key press as confirmation.

Thank you!
fields.summary: New popup windows are unoperatable with keyboard

fields.description:
I'm opening a new issue on this since all the other duplicates were marked as resolved (it was not), and the original open issue is a different bug entirely.

I just updated from an older version of SourceTree (1.7) and my main method of dragging to stage/unstage files no longer works.
fields.summary: Can no longer drag and drop between staged and unstaged

fields.description:
Every time when I switch branches following error occurs, and I must repeatedly try to switch branch.

{{git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout develop
fatal: Unable to create 'C:/projects/mrb/.git/index.lock': File exists.


If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.




Completed with errors, see above.}}

But there is NO other git processes on whole my computer.
I think it is because Sourcetree itself tries to refresh branch and blocks its branch switching.

The same with merge, commit and so on.

Please, can SourceTree understand that there is only it who uses the repo and simply wait for another its own thread which is refreshing repo in background?
fields.summary: Unable to create 'C:/projects/mrb/.git/index.lock': File exists.

fields.description:
In Jira, I need to create a branch for a task. That takes me to bitbucket, where the branch is created and I get an option to ...

```
Check out your branch
This branch does not contain any changes — check it out on your local machine to do some work.

[Check out in SourceTree]

You can also use this command to check out your branch:
```

Clicking the `[Check out in SourceTree]` button, I get the popup for SourceTree.

I can see the branch initially, but then it disappears before I can do anything.

Locally, I have no commits outstanding and nothing to push/pull.

Initially:  !image-2016-08-11-14-42-05-250.png|thumbnail! 
Becomes (after about a second):  !image-2016-08-11-14-42-49-074.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to use "Check out in SourceTree" option

fields.description:
Tried to clone a repo in Source Tree from Bitbucket web site.
Click on repo1 to clone in Source Tree.
Ignore the popup dialog in Source Tree when you need to enter clone folder details.
Click on another repo - repo2 to clone in Source Tree.
Complete cloning by entering the destination folder etc in the popup dialog for repo2.
Realized that repo1 clone dialog is still open. 
Realized that that repo1 is already cloned so cancel the clone dialog.

SourceTree application crashed.
fields.summary: Crashed when cloning a repo

fields.description: Source tree crash everytime I want to commit for first time. I always need to close it first then pull and commit.
fields.summary: Source Tree Crash
